text: I remember that I try to force an update locally to see if that was fixes, because I remember that you did some days ago (you closed the bug ticket in github and I read on the email). But on my side with the dark-theme branch I couldn't see it fixed, so I just did again :thinking_face:. Sometims I dont understand git xD

I have finished the JSON viewer :tada:
It has cool features like:
- minizing nodes (arrays or lists).
- Generate and auto copy snippet of the clicked element key or value. Jinja/HubL READY.
visual tweakings to see it confortably.
- If you copy the whole text, it will be exactly the response without any text/icon injected on the pure json (all managed with pure CSS/JS).

<https://github.com/GonzaloTorreras/JSON-viewer>

I would like someone test it on macs: example:
<https://gonzalotorreras.github.io/JSON-viewer/>

I will work on the integration for the extension :+1:
Very cool well I can test it on Mac for ya. Will give it a shot today
BTW just realized you shared the links publicly in the extension channel, not sure if you were ready for it being public - just giving you a heads up
Just wanted to get fast mac users feedback to be sure that works fine there, before adding to the extension

Major update to the Chrome Extension released: v1.03! Details here: <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/releases/tag/v1.03>
Updates can take up to a week to roll out, but if you wish to force your browser to update the extension you can do so by going to <chrome://extensions> then toggling on developer mode, and hitting update.

Main things to note: Spanish support, major dark theme updates, and new developer menu!
